Title: US House endorses annual defense policy bill, including maintaini...
Description: The House of Representatives passed an annual defense policy bill Wednesday that calls for maintaining 28,500 American troops in Korea and reaffirming the United States' deterrence commitment to the Asian ally.

Title: Afghan refugees minister killed by suicide blast: gov't source
Description: The Afghan minister for refugees was killed on Wednesday in a suicide explosion at the ministry's offices in the capital Kabul, a government source told AFP.

Title: Trump plans major reshaping of U.S. policies within hours of taki...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump is planning a blizzard of more than 25 executive orders and directives on his first day in office on Jan. 20 as he seeks to dramatically reshape U.S. government policy on issues from immigration to energy.

Title: Biden approves national security memo aimed at helping Trump on C...
Description: President Joe Biden has approved a new national security memorandum that is meant to serve as a roadmap for the incoming Trump administration as it looks to counter growing cooperation among China, Iran, North Korea and Russia, the White House said Wednesday.

Title: Khamenei says Assad's fall will not weaken Iran
Description: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said Wednesday the weakening of the anti-Israel 'resistance' after the ouster of Bashar al-Assad in Syria would not diminish Tehran's power.

Title: US defense secretary in Japan to support alliance as Osprey aircr...
Description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin met with officials in Japan on Tuesday to reaffirm the importance of their alliance and Washington's commitment to regional security as threats rise from China and North Korea.

Title: Death toll from contaminated infant IV feeding bags in Mexico ris...
Description: Authorities in Mexico said Tuesday that a total of 17 children have died in central Mexico from suspected contamination of IV feeding bags after four more deaths were confirmed.

Title: UnitedHealth murder suspect has angry outburst as details of his ...
Description: Luigi Mangione, the suspect charged with murder in the shooting of a top UnitedHealth executive, briefly struggled with officers and angrily shouted while being escorted into a Pennsylvania courthouse on Tuesday, as a clearer picture of his motives began to emerge a day after his arrest ended a massive manhunt.

Title: Russian Embassy in N. Korea hosts reception on ratification of mu...
Description: The Russian Embassy in North Korea has hosted a reception to celebrate the ratification of a mutual defense treaty between the two nations, the North's state media reported Wednesday.

Title: N. Korea reports S. Korea's martial law turmoil for 1st time
Description: North Korea's state media on Wednesday reported on the martial law turmoil in South Korea for the first time, including the opposition's push to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol, while blaming Yoon for causing nationwide chaos.

Title: Jordanian man returns home after 38 years in Syria's prisons
Description: A Jordanian man has returned to his home country after spending 38 years in Syrian jails, an official said on Tuesday, after the fall of president Bashar al-Assad ended an agonising wait for his family.

Title: China sends largest naval fleet in decades to region, threat leve...
Description: China is deploying its largest navy fleet in regional waters in nearly three decades, posing a threat to Taiwan that is more pronounced than previous Chinese war games, the Taiwanese defense ministry said on Tuesday.

Title: China's consumer inflation hits 5-month low, leaves room for more...
Description: China's weak consumer price growth in November leaves plenty of room for further monetary policy easing, with earlier stimulus having eased fears of deflation, analysts said.

Title: N. Korean media remain tight-lipped on martial law turmoil in Sou...
Description: North Korea has not reported on last week's martial law declaration in South Korea or its fallout in the following week through Tuesday, including the opposition's push to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol.

Title: Google says it has cracked quantum computing challenge with new c...
Description: Google on Monday said that it has overcome a key challenge in quantum computing with a new generation of chip, solving a computing problem in five minutes that would take a classical computer more time than the history of the universe.

Title: Nobel laureate warns Putin about danger of nuclear weapons
Description: This year's Nobel Peace Prize laureate, Japan's atomic bomb survivors' group Nihon Hidankyo, on Monday urged Russia to stop issuing nuclear threats in a bid to prevail in its war in Ukraine.

Title: Australia-based S. Korean reunites with separated relatives in N....
Description: A South Korean national residing in Australia traveled to North Korea and met with two nephews in October in the first privately arranged separated families reunion in five years, the South Korean unification ministry said Tuesday.

Title: With Syria's Assad gone, his PM agrees to hand power to rebel adm...
Description: Ousted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's prime minister said he had agreed on Monday to hand power to the rebel-led Salvation Government, a day after the rebels seized the capital Damascus and Assad fled to Russia.

Title: Trump promises to end birthright citizenship: What is it, could h...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump has promised to end birthright citizenship as soon as he gets into office to make good on campaign promises aiming to restrict immigration and redefining what it means to be American.

Title: Suspect in killing of UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson in cu...
Description: Authorities have arrested the man suspected of killing UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson in a brazen shooting outside a Manhattan hotel last week, New York City officials said on Monday, ending a massive five-day manhunt.

Title: Top nuclear envoys of Seoul, Washington, Tokyo vow coordination a...
Description: The top nuclear envoys of South Korea, the United States and Japan vowed close coordination Monday to manage 'future situations stably' in the event of any possible provocations by North Korea, Seoul's foreign ministry said.

Title: Polarization' is Merriam-Webster's 2024 word of year
Description: The results of the 2024 U.S. presidential election rattled the country and sent shockwaves across the world - or were cause for celebration, depending on who you ask. Is it any surprise then that the Merriam-Webster word of the year is 'polarization?'

Title: Kremlin refuses to confirm if Assad in Russia
Description: The Kremlin declined on Monday to confirm reports that toppled Syrian president Bashar al-Assad had fled to Moscow, adding that it was 'surprised' by the rebel takeover.

Title: Trump says he will not try to replace Fed's Powell
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said in an interview aired on Sunday he will not try to replace Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell upon taking office in January.

Title: Jack Ma makes rare speech at Ant Group's 20th anniversary, predic...
Description: Jack Ma, the founder of Alibaba Group Holding, gave a rare public speech at the 20th anniversary of the company's fintech affiliate Ant Group, saying he had faith in the 'next 20 years of Ant' and expects 'more miracles', according to Chinese media reports and people who were there.

Title: Trump says he can't guarantee tariffs won't raise prices, won't r...

Title: At Gulf bitcoin gathering, Trump family and allies to bask in cry...
Description: Several key players in President-elect Donald Trump's new cryptocurrency venture head to Abu Dhabi on Monday for the largest bitcoin gathering in the Gulf region as the digital currency sets record highs. Speakers include the president-elect's son Eric and billionaire Steve Witkoff, the new White House envoy for the Middle East and co-founder of World Liberty Financial, a crypto platform launched in September that Donald Trump and his family helped form.

Title: Who is Abu Mohammed al-Golani, leader of the insurgency that topp...
Description: Abu Mohammed al-Golani, the militant leader whose stunning insurgency toppled Syria’s President Bashar Assad, has spent years working to remake his public image , renouncing longtime ties to al-Qaida and depicting himself as a champion of pluralism and tolerance. As he entered Damascus behind his victorious fighters Sunday, he even dropped his nom de guerre and referred to himself with his real name, Ahmad al-Sharaa.

Title: Biden calls for Assad to be 'held accountable'
Description: U.S. President Joe Biden on Sunday said deposed Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad should be 'held accountable' but called the nation's political upheaval a 'historic opportunity' for Syrians to rebuild their country.

Title: Russia says Syria's Assad has left country and gave orders for pe...
Description: The Russian foreign ministry said on Sunday that Syrian President Bashar al-Assad had left office and departed the country after giving orders there be a peaceful handover of power.

Title: Trump, Zelenskyy, Macron hold surprise meeting in Paris; Musk als...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy joined French President Emmanuel Macron for the official reopening Saturday of the famed Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris.

Title: Syria rebels celebrate in captured Homs, set sights on Damascus
Description: Syrian rebels announced they gained full control over the key city of Homs early on Sunday after only a day of fighting, leaving President Bashar al-Assad's 24-year rule dangling by a thread as insurgents marched on the capital, Damascus.

Title: US unveils $988 mil. aid package for Ukraine including rockets, d...
Description: The United States unveiled a $988 million aid package of new arms and equipment to Ukraine for its ongoing fight against Russia's invasion on Saturday.

Title: Rebels declare end of Assad rule in Syria
Description: Islamist-led rebels declared that they have taken Damascus in a lightning offensive on Sunday, sending President Bashar al-Assad fleeing and ending five decades of Baath rule in Syria.

Title: Open your doors': Notre Dame re-opens after five-year refit
Description: France celebrated the re-opening of the newly restored Notre Dame cathedral on Saturday at a special church service that featured a standing ovation for the firefighters who saved the 12th-century landmark during a 2019 blaze.

Title: Trump in Paris as Notre Dame reopens five years after blaze
Description: U.S. president-elect Donald Trump on Saturday arrived in Paris to join other world leaders for the reopening of the French capital's Notre Dame cathedral, celebrating its remarkably rapid restoration half a decade after the devastating fire.

Title: Syrian rebels seize 4th city, close in on Homs in threat to Assad...
Description: Syrian rebels said they seized control of the southern city of Daraa on Saturday, the birthplace of a 2011 uprising against President Bashar al-Assad and the fourth city his forces have lost in a week.

Title: Hong Kong tightens airport health checks amid DR Congo mystery di...
Description: Hong Kong authorities have stepped up health screening measures for all flights arriving from African transit hubs as they brace for risks of an unidentified disease that killed at least 79 in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).

Title: Trump names former Senator David Perdue to be ambassador to China
Description: President-elect Donald Trump said Thursday he has selected former Sen. David Perdue of Georgia to serve as his ambassador to China, leaning on a former business executive turned politician to serve as the administration's envoy to America's most potent economic and military adversary.

Title: Hong Kong tightens airport health checks amid DR Congo mystery di...
Description: Hong Kong authorities have stepped up health screening measures for all flights arriving from African transit hubs as they brace for risks of an unidentified disease that killed at least 79 in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).

Title: Who is President Yoon who imposed martial law?
Description: Decades of achievement led Yoon Suk Yeol to the pinnacle of political power in South Korea, but his legacy may now rest on a single, baffling decision to send out troops under martial law over vague claims that one of Asia's leading democracies was under threat.

Title: France's Macron vows to stay on, promises PM in 'coming days'
Description: President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday vowed to name a new prime minister in the coming days to prevent France from sliding deeper into political turmoil, rejecting growing pressure from the opposition to resign.

Title: N. Korea to hold parliamentary session next month to discuss cons...
Description: North Korea will hold a key session of its rubber-stamp parliament next month to discuss a range of issues, including a constitutional amendment, the North's state media reported Friday.

Title: Islamist-led rebels capture key Syrian city of Hama
Description: Islamist-led rebel forces captured the central Syrian city of Hama on Thursday, overrunning forces loyal to President Bashar al-Assad only days after capturing Aleppo in a lightning offensive.

Title: Macron hunts for new PM as government resignation looms
Description: French President Emmanuel Macron was meeting allies and senior politicians on Thursday as he sought to swiftly appoint a new prime minister, a day after far-right and leftist lawmakers toppled Michel Barnier's minority government.

Title: European satellites launched to create artificial solar eclipses ...
Description: A pair of European satellites rocketed into orbit Thursday on the first mission to create artificial solar eclipses through fancy formation flying in space.

Title: Ukraine, Russian diplomats trade barbs at Malta summit
Description: Ukraine's foreign minister called Russia's top diplomat Sergei Lavrov a 'war criminal' Thursday as they both attended an international summit in Malta, the latter's first visit to an EU member since the 2022 invasion.

Title: Trump picks Musk ally Jared Isaacman to head NASA

Title: UnitedHealth executive killed in Manhattan in targeted attack

Title: N. Korea-Russia defense treaty goes into effect Dec. 4: state med...

Title: Russia supporting N.Korea nuclear program in exchange for troops:...
Description: NATO chief Mark Rutte said Wednesday that Russia was giving support to North Korea's missile and nuclear programs in exchange for Pyongyang sending troops to fight in the war with Ukraine.

Title: Search extends into night for Pennsylvania woman who may have fal...
Description: A grandmother looking for her lost cat apparently fell into a sinkhole that had recently opened above an abandoned western Pennsylvania coal mine and rescuers worked late into the night Tuesday to try and find her.

Title: Intel approaches candidates for CEO role, including former board ...

Title: Korea vows 'unlimited' liquidity measures after political turmoil...

Description: The unification ministry said Wednesday it will focus on stably managing the situation with North Korea while adhering to its principle-based policy toward Pyongyang, following the short-lived declaration of martial law.

Title: US urges citizens in Korea to avoid areas where protests taking p...

Title: Meta says no sign of AI bedeviling elections in 2024

Title: Notre Dame to reopen this week with Trump in attendance

Title: China bans exports of gallium, germanium, antimony to US

Title: Trump reiterates opposition to Nippon Steel's takeover of US Stee...

Title: Seoul urges N. Korea to 'unconditionally' release detained S. Kor...

Title: Russia used some 60 N. Korean ballistic missiles in Ukraine war: ...
Description: Russia is believed to have used some 60 ballistic missiles provided by North Korea in the war against Ukraine, a Ukrainian media outlet has reported, citing its intelligence authorities.

Title: French government faces no-confidence vote over Barnier's austeri...
Description: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier is bracing for a no-confidence vote this week, a political reckoning almost certain to topple his fragile government and send shockwaves across the eurozone.

Title: US urges push for Syria de-escalation
Description: The United States called Monday for de-escalation in Syria, where an Islamist-led rebel alliance has wrested swathes of territory from the control of President Bashar al-Assad's government in a lightning offensive.

Title: Latest US clampdown on China's chips hits semiconductor toolmaker...
Description: The United States on Monday launched its third crackdown in three years on China's semiconductor industry, curbing exports to 140 companies, including chip equipment maker Naura Technology Group, among other moves.

Title: Hezbollah attack draws Israeli strikes on Lebanon, killing 11 peo...
Description: Israel unleashed its largest wave of airstrikes across Lebanon since agreeing to a ceasefire with Hezbollah last week, killing at least 11 people on Monday after the Lebanese militant group fired a volley of projectiles as a warning over what it said were Israeli truce violations .

Title: N. Korea's weather agency officials visit Russia
Description: A delegation of North Korean weather agency officials has left for Russia, the North's state media reported Tuesday, as Pyongyang and Moscow have been expanding cooperation in various fields.

Title: US calls NK troops in combat against Ukraine 'legitimate ' target...
Description: A U.S. State Department spokesperson reiterated Monday that North Korean troops in combat against Ukrainian forces are 'legitimate' targets, amid news reports about troop casualties on the battlefield.

Title: N. Korea to convene key party meeting in late December weeks ahea...
Description: North Korea has decided to convene a plenary meeting of the ruling Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) late this month, state media reported Tuesday, amid anticipation as to what message the North will send toward U.S. President-elect Donald Trump.

Title: Philippine groups seek impeachment of Vice President Duterte

Title: China condemns Lithuania's expulsion of its diplomats

Title: Biden pardons his son Hunter despite previous pledges not to

Title: Chief of International Criminal Court lashes out at US and Russia...
Description: The president of the International Criminal Court lashed out at the United States and Russia for interfering with its investigations, calling threats and attacks on the court 'appalling.'

Title: [ANALYSIS] Global push for cooperation as space traffic crowds Ea...
Description: The rapid increase in satellites and space junk will make low Earth orbit unusable unless companies and countries cooperate and share the data needed to manage that most accessible region of space, experts and industry insiders said.

Title: Meta tightens ad rules to curb financial scams aimed at Australia...
Description: Instagram and Facebook-owner Meta Platforms said on Monday it had introduced stricter rules for advertisers of financial products and services targeting Australians, in a bid to crack down on scams on the social media platforms.

Title: OpenAI's Altman confident Trump will keep US in AI lead

Title: N. Korea demolishing S. Korean-built golf course clubhouse at Mou...
Description: North Korea has been demolishing a golf course clubhouse built by a South Korean firm at the Mount Kumgang resort, leaving only a few facilities intact in the area, South Korea's unification ministry said Monday.

Title: Syria launches counterattacks in an attempt to halt insurgency, a...

Title: Trump names Lebanese-American businessman Massad Boulos as Middle...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Sunday named Lebanese-American businessman Massad Boulos as his senior advisor on Arab and Middle Eastern affairs, the latest family member to be appointed to a key position.

Title: Zelenskyy says NK troops deployed to western Russia killed, injur...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said North Korean soldiers deployed to western Russia have been killed or injured during combat against Ukrainian forces, adding to global criticism they will be used as 'cannon fodder' for Moscow, a Japanese report showed.

Title: UN says it is halting aid deliveries through main Gaza crossing b...
Description: The U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees said Sunday it is halting aid deliveries through the main cargo crossing into the war-ravaged Gaza Strip because of the threat of armed gangs who have looted recent convoys. It blamed the breakdown of law and order in large part on Israeli policies.

Title: Syria sends in reinforcements to halt insurgents from advancing a...
Description: The Syrian military rushed in reinforcements Sunday to push back insurgents from advancing farther into the northern Hama countryside after they seized Aleppo and surrounding strategic locations in an adjacent province in a surprise offensive.

Title: Iraq MPs to debate revised bill after outcry over underage marria...
Description: Iraq's parliament will review contentious legal amendments Sunday, including a reworked family law bill that has sparked civil society outrage over fears of a resurgence in underage marriages.

Title: Putin signs off record Russian defense spending
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin approved budget plans, raising 2025 military spending to record levels as Moscow seeks to prevail in the war in Ukraine .

Title: Forced labor drives North Korea's wig exports: report

Title: Syrian rebels sweep into Aleppo, Russia conducts strikes in suppo...
Description: The Syrian army said on Saturday dozens of its soldiers had been killed in a major attack led by Islamist Hayat Tahrir al-Sham rebels who swept into the city of Aleppo, forcing the army to redeploy in the biggest challenge to President Bashar al-Assad in years.

Title: China sentences journalist detained at meal with Japanese diploma...
Description: A court in Beijing on Friday sentenced a prominent Chinese journalist to seven years in prison for espionage, his family said.

Title: Why S. Korea is now bigger player in US-China cyberwarfare
Description: For three days earlier this year, defense personnel from more than 20 NATO and Indo-Pacific countries descended on the South Korean capital to work out what a regional cyberwar might look like.

Title: Russia's defense chief departs Pyongyang after 2-day visit: KCNA
Description: Russia's Defense Minister Andrei Belousov has left Pyongyang after a two-day visit during which he met with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, the North's state media reported Sunday.

Title: Protesters gather for 3rd night of demonstrations after Georgia a...
Description: Protesters gathered across Georgia on Saturday night in a third straight night of demonstrations against the government’s decision to suspend negotiations to join the European Union.

Title: Trump threatens 100% tariff on BRICS countries over currency plan...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump on Monday threatened to impose a 100 percent tariff on the BRICS group nations if they undercut the U.S. dollar.

Title: Over 100 countries back plastic treaty caps as talks reach fierce...
Description: Negotiators aiming for an international treaty to curb plastic pollution are set for fierce debate on the last day of scheduled talks, as over 100 countries supportive of a pact that would cap plastic production face off against a handful of oil-producing countries who want it focused just on waste.

Title: Canada's Trudeau returns home after Trump meeting without assuran...
Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau returned home Saturday after his meeting with Donald Trump without assurances the president-elect will back away from threatened tariffs on all products from the major American trading partner. Trump called the talks 'productive' but signaled no retreat from a pledge that Canada says unfairly lumps it in with Mexico over the flow of drugs and migrants into the United States.

Title: NK leader calls for regions' efforts for independent development
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has visited an offshore fishing farm under construction in the eastern port city of Sinpho, calling for regions to use their own natural and economic resources in a bid to develop themselves independently, state media reported Tuesday.

Title: Trump promises 25% tariff on Mexico and Canada, extra 10% tariff ...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Monday pledged a 25 percent tariff on all products from Mexico and Canada from his first day in office, and an additional 10 percent tariff on goods from China, citing illegal immigration and the trade of illicit drugs.

Title: N. Korea cuts power lines supplying electricity to shuttered Kaes...
Description: North Korea has cut power lines installed by South Korea to supply electricity to a now-shuttered joint industrial park in the North Korean border city of Kaesong, South Korea's military said, the latest in Pyongyang's move to sever inter-Korean ties.

Title: Judge tosses Trump 2020 election case after prosecutors' request

Title: N. Korea sent 100 ballistic missiles, military specialists to Rus...
Description: North Korea has supplied more than 100 KN-23 and KN-24 ballistic missiles, and dispatched military specialists to Russia in support of its war with Ukraine, a Ukrainian defense intelligence unit has said.

Title: Israel to decide on ceasefire as US says deal 'close'

Title: Newsom says California could offer electric vehicle rebates if Tr...
Description: California could offer rebates for electric vehicle purchases if the incoming Trump administration eliminates a federal tax credit for people who buy electric cars, Gov. Gavin Newsom said Monday.

Title: NK tightens control to quell unrest over troop dispatch to Russia
Description: North Korea is intensifying internal control over its military and citizens in what seems to be an effort to suppress any dissent regarding the regime's troop deployment to support Russia's war against Ukraine, the Ministry of Unification said, Tuesday.

Title: Musk's Neuralink to launch feasibility trial with brain implant, ...
Description: Elon Musk's brain technology startup Neuralink said on Monday it has received approval to launch a new feasibility study using its brain implant and an experimental robotic arm.

Title: NK leader's sister again denounces 'political agitation' leaflets...
Description: The powerful sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un on Tuesday denounced 'political agitation' leaflets, accusing South Korea of sending them across the border.

Title: UN head say social media, AI fuelling 'worst human impulses'
Description: Uncontrolled social media networks and artificial intelligence amplify the worst human impulses, allowing hate speech to spread like wildfire and ignite violence, UN secretary general Antonio Guterres said on Tuesday.

Title: Trump team considers 'direct talks' with N. Korea's Kim: report
Description: President-elect Donald Trump's team is considering 'pursuing direct talks' with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un in hopes of reducing the risks of armed conflict, Reuters has reported.

Title: As Arctic climate warms, even Santa runs short of snow
Description: With a month to go until Christmas, Santa Claus is busy preparing, but the warming climate and lack of snow in his Arctic hometown have him worried.

Title: CCTV cameras spotted in NK classrooms, potentially signaling incr...

Title: Israel, Lebanon's Hezbollah agree to ceasefire after nearly 14 mo...
Description: Israel approved a ceasefire agreement with Lebanon's Hezbollah militants on Tuesday that would end nearly 14 months of fighting linked to the war in the Gaza Strip.

Description: South Korea's military said Friday North Korea has sent around 40 balloons filled with trash across the border into the South since the previous night, with most of them landing in the broader capital area.

Title: Russia accelerates advance in Ukraine's east

Title: Russia's ties with N. Korea 'expanding,' including on military: R...
Description: Russian Defense Minister Andrey Belousov said Friday during his visit to Pyongyang that Russia's cooperation with North Korea is 'expanding' in various areas, including in the military field.

Title: China state media dismiss Trump's tariff vow, focus on fentanyl

Title: China declines comment on marriage of son of jailed official Bo X...
Description: China declined on Wednesday to comment about the marriage of the son of jailed former leader Bo Xilai to an individual from Taiwan, saying only that it opposed 'malicious' speculation about the matter.

Title: ICC prosecutor requests arrest warrants for the head of Myanmar's...
Description: The International Criminal Court’s chief prosecutor asked judges on Wednesday to issue an arrest warrant for the head of Myanmar’s military regime for crimes committed against the country’s Rohingya Muslim minority .

Title: Biden readies $725 mil. arms aid package for Ukraine: sources
Description: U.S. President Joe Biden's administration is preparing a $725 million weapons package for Ukraine, two U.S. officials said on Wednesday, as the outgoing president seeks to bolster the government in Kyiv before leaving office in January.

Title: Tens of thousands in Lebanon head home as Israel-Hezbollah truce ...
Description: Tens of thousands of Lebanese displaced by the war between Israel and Hezbollah headed back to their devastated towns and villages Wednesday as a ceasefire took hold.

Title: Trump taps retired general for key Ukraine conflict role
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Wednesday named staunch loyalist and retired general Keith Kellogg as his Ukraine envoy, charged with ending the two-and-a-half-year Russian invasion.

Title: Conservative US influencer barred from New Zealand weeks after ba...
Description: The U.S. conservative political commentor Candace Owens was refused a visa to enter New Zealand for a speaking engagement because she had been banned from another country, immigration officials said Thursday.

Title: AI Jesus' avatar tests man's faith in machines and the divine
Description: Would you trust an 'AI Jesus' with your innermost thoughts and troubles?

Title: Biden says he hopes Trump rethinks tariffs on Mexico and Canada
Description: U.S. President Joe Biden on Thursday said he hoped President-elect Donald Trump would rethink his plan to impose tariffs on Mexico and Canada, saying it could 'screw up' relationships with close allies.

Title: ECB chief Lagarde warns Europe against US tariff retaliation
Description: European Central Bank (ECB) President Christine Lagarde has warned against taking retaliatory measures in response to potential new tariffs imposed by U.S. President-elect Donald Trump, in an interview to the Financial Times newspaper published on Thursday.

Title: Rights for same-sex couples, transgender people in Hong Kong long...
Description: A landmark ruling by the top court in favor of equal housing and inheritance rights for married same-sex couples is the latest in a long line intended to ensure fairer treatment for the LGBTQ community.

Title: Amazon workers in India join Black Friday strike action
Description: Amazon staff in India have joined strike action calling for better wages and working conditions as the company prepares for one of the busiest shopping periods of the year.

Description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau visited Donald Trump's Florida resort Friday to meet with the U.S. president-elect, days after Trump threatened to slap tariffs on Canadian imports over border-related concerns.

Title: Ukraine asks NATO for membership invite next week, letter shows
Description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha has urged his NATO counterparts to issue an invitation to Kyiv to join the Western military alliance at a meeting in Brussels next week , according to the text of a letter seen by Reuters on Friday.

Title: Senior Russian diplomat says possibility of new nuclear tests rem...
Description: A possible resumption of nuclear weapons tests by Moscow remains an open question in view of hostile U.S. policies, a senior Russian diplomat was quoted as saying early Saturday.

Title: US approves $385 mil. arms sale to Taiwan
Description: The U.S. State Department has approved the potential sale of spare parts for F-16 jets and radars to Taiwan for an estimated $385 million, the Pentagon said on Friday, a day before Taiwan President Lai Ching-te starts a sensitive Pacific trip.

Title: Iceland votes for new parliament amid disagreements on immigratio...
Description: Icelanders are electing a new parliament Saturday after disagreements over immigration, energy policy and the economy forced Prime Minister Bjarni Benediktsson to pull the plug on his coalition government and call an early election.

Description: A court in Beijing on Friday sentenced a prominent Chinese journalist to seven in years in prison for espionage, his family said.

Title: Iceland set for change of government as surging prices dominate e...
